Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "River Valley Constituency" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(January 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **River Valley Constituency** was a constituency in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It used to exist from 1959 to 1988. The 1959 election in River Valley remains the record for the closest winning margin in any election in Singapore history. ## History In 1988, the constituency was dissolved following the establishment of [Group representation constituency](/wiki/Group_representation_constituency) (GRC) and [Single Member Constituency](/wiki/Single_Member_Constituency) (SMC). ## Member of Parliament **Election** **Member****Party****Formation**[Legislative Assembly of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore)**1959**Lim Cheng Lock[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1963**[Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore)**1968**Low Guan Onn[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1972**Tan Eng Liang**1976****1980**[Tay Eng Soon](/wiki/Tay_Eng_Soon)**1984****Constituency abolished (1988)** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates.
